references.paper_title: Any-property-conditional molecule generation with self-criticism using spanning trees
references.reason: This is the primary method used in the current research, forming the basis for the active learning approach.

references.paper_title: Spanning tree-based graph generation for molecules
references.reason: This paper introduces the STGG+ model, a key component of the proposed method, which is substantially improved upon in the current work.

references.paper_title: GFN2-xTB-an accurate and broadly parametrized self-consistent tight-binding quantum chemical method with multipole electrostatics and density-dependent dispersion contributions
references.reason: This paper describes the GFN2-xTB method, used for geometry optimization and optical property approximation, which is crucial for evaluating generated molecules.

references.paper_title: Ultra-fast computation of electronic spectra for large systems by tight-binding based simplified tamm-dancoff approximation (sTDA-xTB)
references.reason: This paper introduces the sTDA-xTB method, employed for approximating oscillator strength and absorption wavelengths, essential for evaluating molecular properties.

references.paper_title: Molecular de-novo design through deep reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper is a key comparative baseline method for molecular generation, providing context for the advantages of the proposed active learning approach.
